entry.name: ‎Abortifacient Agents, Nonsteroidal‎
entry.description: Non-steroidal chemical compounds with abortifacient activity.

entry.name: ‎Acaricide‎
entry.description: agent that kills members of the arachnid subclass Acari

entry.name: ‎ACE inhibitor‎
entry.description: pharmaceutical drug used primarily for the treatment of hypertension (elevated blood pressure) and congestive heart failure

entry.name: ‎analgesic‎
entry.description: pharmaceutical drug

entry.name: ‎anesthetic‎
entry.description: drug that causes anesthesia

entry.name: ‎non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug‎
entry.description: class of drug

entry.name: ‎Anti-Allergic Agents‎
entry.description: Agents that are used to treat allergic reactions. Most of these drugs act by preventing the release of inflammatory mediators or inhibiting the actions of released mediators on their target cells. (from ama drug evaluations annual, 1994, p475)

entry.name: ‎Anti-Asthmatic Agents‎
entry.description: Drugs that are used to treat asthma

entry.name: ‎bactericide‎
entry.description: substance that kills bacteria

entry.name: ‎cholinesterase inhibitor‎
entry.description: drugs that inhibit cholinesterases

entry.name: ‎anticonvulsant‎
entry.description: class of medications

entry.name: ‎antiemetic‎
entry.description: drug used to prevent nausea or vomiting

entry.name: ‎antifungal medication‎
entry.description: Category of pharmaceutical drugs

entry.name: ‎histamine antagonist‎
entry.description: drug that binds to but does not activate histamine receptors, thereby blocking the actions of histamine or histamine agonists

entry.name: ‎non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug‎
entry.description: class of drug

entry.name: ‎antimalarial‎
entry.description: Agents used in the treatment of malaria. They are usually classified on the basis of their action against plasmodia at different stages in their life cycle in the human. (from ama, drug evaluations annual, 1992, p1585)

entry.name: ‎multiple drug resistance‎
entry.description: antimicrobial resistance to multiple drugs

entry.name: ‎ATC code A08‎
entry.description: Antiobesity preparations, excluding diet products is a therapeutic subgroup of the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification System

entry.name: ‎antioxidant‎
entry.description: molecule that inhibits the oxidation of other molecules

entry.name: ‎antipruritic‎
entry.description: drug, usually applied topically, that relieves pruritus (itching)

entry.name: ‎antipyretic‎
entry.description: drug that prevents or reduces fever by lowering the body temperature from a raised state

entry.name: ‎antispasmodic‎
entry.description: class of medications

entry.name: ‎antitussive‎
entry.description: Agents that suppress cough. They act centrally on the medullary cough center. Expectorants, also used in the treatment of cough, act locally

entry.name: ‎anti-ulcer drug‎
entry.description: class of drugs used to treat or ameliorate peptic ulcer or irritation of the gastrointestinal tract

entry.name: ‎antiviral drug‎
entry.description: Class of medications

entry.name: ‎apoptotic process‎
entry.description: programmed cell death process

entry.name: ‎bacteriostatic agent‎
entry.description: biological or chemical agent that stops bacteria from reproducing, while not necessarily killing them otherwise

entry.name: ‎calcium channel blocker‎
entry.description: several medications that disrupt the movement of calcium (Ca2+) through calcium channels

entry.name: ‎depressant‎
entry.description: drug or endogenous compound that lowers neurotransmission levels

entry.name: ‎convulsant‎
entry.description: substance that acts in the brain stem or spinal cord to produce tonic or clonic convulsions, often by removing normal inhibitory tone

entry.name: ‎COX-2 inhibitor‎
entry.description: A subclass of cyclooxygenase inhibitors with specificity for cyclooxygenase-2

entry.name: ‎chemotherapy‎
entry.description: treatment of cancer with one or more cytotoxic anti-neoplastic drugs

entry.name: ‎decongestant‎
entry.description: drug to relieve nasal congestion

entry.name: ‎deodorant‎
entry.description: substance applied to the body to prevent body odor

entry.name: ‎diuretic‎
entry.description: substance that promotes the production of urine

entry.name: ‎emetic‎
entry.description: drug that induces vomiting

entry.name: ‎fungicide‎
entry.description: pesticide used to kill fungi

entry.name: ‎Terconazole‎
entry.description: chemical compound

entry.name: ‎herbicide‎
entry.description: chemical used to kill unwanted plants

entry.name: ‎histamine antagonist‎
entry.description: drug that binds to but does not activate histamine receptors, thereby blocking the actions of histamine or histamine agonists

entry.name: ‎hypnotic‎
entry.description: class of medications

entry.name: ‎insect repellent‎
entry.description: substance which repels insects

entry.name: ‎insecticide‎
entry.description: pesticide used against insects

entry.name: ‎irritant dermatitis‎
entry.description: Human disease

entry.name: ‎laxative‎
entry.description: Agents that produce a soft formed stool, and relax and loosen the bowels, typically used over a protracted period, to relieve constipation

entry.name: ‎ornithine decarboxylase inhibitor- sigma54 transciptional regulator RB4179‎
entry.description: microbial gene found in Rhodopirellula baltica SH 1

entry.name: ‎perfumery‎
entry.description: shop which sells perfumes

entry.name: ‎pesticide‎
entry.description: substance used to destroy pests

entry.name: ‎pheromone‎
entry.description: secreted or excreted chemical factor that triggers a social response in members of the same species

entry.name: ‎photosensitizer‎
entry.description: A photosensitizer is a molecule that produces a chemical change in another molecule in a photochemical process.

entry.name: ‎Spermicide‎
entry.description: birth control

entry.name: ‎stimulant‎
entry.description: type of psychoactive drug

entry.name: ‎tranquilizer‎
entry.description: drug that induces tranquility in an individual

entry.name: ‎transdermal‎
entry.description: route of administration wherein active ingredients are delivered across the skin

entry.name: ‎vasodilator agent‎
entry.description: drug used to cause dilation of the blood vessels

entry.name: ‎anthelmintic‎
entry.description: substance intended to kill helminths (parasitic worms)
